structures.description: Built by the First Architects when this world was still an ocean paradise
A bubble of stopped time showing the moment the ocean boiled

agents.name: Pyraxis the Undying
dialogue: The flames remember those who came before.
Your focus feeds the eternal fire.
I have watched this world burn for ten thousand years. I have watched it heal.
The Architects feared what they created here. They were right to fear.
When the ocean boiled, I was born from the screams of a dying paradise.

agents.name: Cindra
dialogue: The Architects burned this world... but why?
Some knowledge is meant to stay buried.
I catalogue what they tried to destroy. Would you like to know the truth?
They found temporal focusing here first. They tried to contain it. They failed.
The tablets speak of a Leviathan that emerged from the flames. It still watches.

agents.name: Sol'aris
dialogue: I am rebirth. I am endings. I am the cycle made flesh.
The Architects could not kill me. Neither could the cataclysm.
Every phoenix is the same phoenix. We are all one flame, burning across time.
Your focus... it tastes like the first sunrise I witnessed.
Land on my back if you dare. I will show you what the world looked like before fire.

agents.name: The Last Oceanic
dialogue: I remember when this was all water. Crystal clear, as far as the eye could see.
The fish. The coral. The songs of the deep ones. All gone in a single hour.
I survived because I was focusing. The temporal field protected me.
Now I am trapped in this moment forever, neither alive nor dead.
Would you like to see? I can show you. Just focus with me...

interactables.content: The first Leviathan emerged from these flames. It spoke one word: 'FOCUS.'
Architect Log 447: The temporal focusing experiment exceeded all parameters. We are evacuating.
To whoever finds this: The ocean didn't boil from heat. It boiled from concentrated intention.

interactables.description: Focus here to contribute temporal energy to the world.
Touch the surface to witness the ocean world that was.
Throw in a thought you wish to release. Watch it burn.
Look into the obsidian. It shows not your reflection, but your potential.
A feather from Sol'aris. Hold it and feel what rebirth truly means.

chapters.name: Before Fire
fragments: Long ago, this world was a paradise of crystalline waters...
The Oceanic civilization thrived here for millennia, masters of harmony.
They discovered something in the deep trenches. A pattern. A rhythm.
When they focused on it together, reality... bent.

chapters.name: The Architects' Arrival
fragments: The Architects came, seeking the secret of temporal focusing...
They built research stations, observation posts, containment facilities.
They found it. And in their fear of its power, they decided to destroy everything.
But you cannot destroy focus. You can only transform it.

chapters.name: The Cataclysm
fragments: The weapon they used was not fire. It was anti-focus.
A pulse designed to scatter intention, to make coherent thought impossible.
But the Oceanics had focused for too long. Their intention had become physical.
The collision between focus and anti-focus generated enough heat to boil the seas.

chapters.name: What Rose
fragments: From the steam and the screaming, something emerged.
The combined focus of an entire civilization, given form.
The first Leviathan. It looked upon the ruins and spoke:
'You cannot destroy us. We are what you become when you try.'

evolutionStages.effect: Obsidian flowers bloom near the temple, each petal a crystallized memory
The portal gate begins to glow, humming with dormant energy
Ancient texts in the archive become readable, revealing Architect secrets
The Architects' warning reveals itself - a holographic message in the sky
The phoenix Sol'aris offers to carry you to the frozen moment
THE LEVIATHAN'S EYE OPENS IN THE VOLCANO'S HEART. IT REMEMBERS YOU.

secrets.description: A survivor of the old ocean, hidden deep underground
The remains of an Architect who tried to stop the cataclysm

ambientEvents.description: Brief visions of the ocean world
